definition: Beware of suspicious folk bearing gifts, they are sure to be ill-intentioned. (idiom)
pinyin: huang2 shu3 lang2 gei3 ji1 bai4 nian2

definition: surname Huang or Hwang
yellow/pornographic/to fall through
rat/mouse/CL:隻|只[zhi1]

to supply/to provide

definition: to have bad intentions
the cat weeps for the dead mouse (idiom); hypocritical pretence of condolence/crocodile tears
lit. One doesn't visit a temple without a cause. (idiom)/fig. to visit sb with an ulterior motive (esp. to ask for sth)/having a hidden agenda
pinyin: wu2 shi4 bu4 deng1 san1 bao3 dian4

definition: He who comes is surely ill-intentioned, no-one well-meaning will come (idiom)./Be careful not to trust foreigners./Beware of Greeks bearing gifts!
pinyin: lai2 zhe3 bu4 shan4 , shan4 zhe3 bu4 lai2

definition: to have an axe to grind (idiom)
lit. a dog who catches mice/to be meddlesome (idiom)
no ivory comes from the mouth of a dog (idiom)/no good words are to be expected from a scoundrel
pinyin: gou3 zui3 li5 tu3 bu4 chu1 xiang4 ya2

definition: lit. to destroy the bridge after crossing the river (idiom)/fig. to abandon one's benefactor upon achieving one's goal
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
to have hidden meaning/implication/more than just the apparent meaning/something hinted
phoney mercy/sham benevolence/crocodile tears
a dog biting Lü Dongbin (idiom)/to ill reward a person's kindness
pinyin: gou3 yao3 Lu:3 Dong4 bin1 , bu4 shi2 hao3 ren2 xin1
related.word: 狗咬吕洞宾，不识好人心

definition: one may know a person for a long time without understanding his true nature (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 ren2 zhi1 mian4 bu4 zhi1 xin1

definition: lit. a dagger hidden in smiles (idiom); friendly manners belying hypocritical intentions/when the fox preaches, look to the geese
to harbor evil intentions (idiom)
lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3
